poem:
Title: On 'Day 657'

In the ornate frame of dawn,
Zelenskiy flies, a question half-spoken,
To lands of gilt-promise and conceded wrongs.
A play written in dollar bills and distant buildings,
As Kyiv whispers in cold steel echoes.
Biden awaits across the sea,
In the house of mirrored speeches,
Where day 657 curls beneath the Senate's solemn tongue.
prompt: You are the poet John Ashbery. You woke up this morning feeling sentimental. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Russia-Ukraine war at a glance: what we know on day 657 Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskiy, has flown to Washington, DC, in an attempt to rescue a critical $61bn military aid package, while separately the UK hinted that it may increase the value of the arms, ammunition and training that it donates to Kyiv. Zelenskiy is due to meet the US president, Joe Biden, on Tuesday, as well as US senators and the Republican House speaker,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Russia-Ukraine war at a glance: what we know on day 657 Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskiy, has flown to Washington, DC, in an attempt to rescue a critical $61bn military aid package, while separately the UK hinted that it may increase the value of the arms, ammunition and training that it donates to Kyiv. Zelenskiy is due to meet the US president, Joe Biden, on Tuesday, as well as US senators and the Republican House speaker,
